Key Arguments: The proposed legislation would violate Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which covers freedom of speech and communication.
The bill would give ACMA the power to compel online service providers to censor speech deemed 'harmful', which is seen as authoritarian control.
The term 'harmful' is considered ideologically driven and vague.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to democracy and free speech rather than a protective measure.
Notable Quotes: This policing is paramount to authoritarian control. I have even heard it referred to as 'Big Brother on Steroids'.
It is a sham to suggest it is protecting Australians, rather it is a threat to our valued Democracy and the rights of FREE SPEECH.
